subject: TiiS Call for Papers: Special issue on Interactive Visual Analytics for Making Explainable and Accountable Decisions
body:
CALL FOR PAPERS ACM Transactions on Interactive Intelligent Systems (TiiS) Special Issue on Interactive Visual Analytics for Making Explainable and Accountable Decisions Guest Editors * Dr. Cagatay Turkay, City, University of London, UK * Prof. Tatiana von Landesberger, Karlsruhe Institute of Technology, Germany * Dr. Remco Chang, Tufts University, USA * Dr. Shixia Liu, Tsinghua University, China * Dr. Daniel Archambault, Swansea University, Wales ----------------------------------------------------------------------- Background Due to recent advances in Artificial Intelligence, complex and advanced machine learning models have been developed and used increasingly in making data-driven decisions that have significant impact on science, business, and the wider society. Although effective, the complexity of these models can often make the results difficult to understand, explain, evaluate, and scrutinize. There is therefore a significant demand from governments, businesses, and the wider society for interpretable, explainable and accountable decision-making models and systems. Interactive visual analytics offer great potential in this space by marrying human intelligence with machine power, through visual representations of data and interaction techniques, to aid humans in better generating, interpreting, evaluating, and deploying statistical and machine learning models. In this special issue, we will feature cutting-edge research where interactive visual analytics methods are applied together with complex computational methods for making explainable and accountable decisions informed by data. Scope, Description, and More Information This special issue invites submissions that feature original research on designing, developing and evaluating interactive visual analytics methods that empower their users to make explainable and accountable inferences and decisions based on massive amounts of data. A suitable submission must also demonstrate its relevance to TiiS, the premier journal featuring interactive intelligent systems with two distinct characteristics: intelligence and interactivity. In particular, a suitable submission must exhibit or discuss how the resulting approaches, techniques, or systems advance an interactive intelligent system. Interdisciplinary and applied research is especially encouraged. Specific areas of interest include, but are not limited to: * Role of interactive visualization in interpretable and explainable machine learning * Human factors in making decisions with machine learning models * Facilitating algorithmic transparency and accountability through visual analytics * Interactive visualization for supporting non-experts in creating and interpreting complex analysis results * Visual analytics for interactive, informed machine-learning model building * Uncertainty-aware visual analytics for the consideration of inherent uncertainty in data and models * Interactive visual analytics for addressing biases in the data and machine learning models Schedule * Full paper submission deadline: November 17, 2019 * First author notification: Feb 14, 2020 * Revised paper due: April 20, 2020 * Final author notification: May 15, 2020 * Expected publication: Summer 2020 Check out http://tiis.acm.org/authors.cfm for author information and submission details. Dr. Cagatay Turkay, City, University of London, UK
Prof. Tatiana von Landesberger, Karlsruhe Institute of Technology, Germany

Dr. Daniel Archambault, Swansea University, Wales


Background

Due to recent advances in Artificial Intelligence, complex and advanced machine learning models have been developed and used increasingly in making data-driven decisions that have significant impact on science, business, and the wider society. Although effective, the complexity of these models can often make the results difficult to understand, explain, evaluate, and scrutinize. There is therefore a significant demand from governments, businesses, and the wider society for interpretable, explainable and accountable decision-making models and systems.

Interactive visual analytics offer great potential in this space by marrying human intelligence with machine power, through visual representations of data and interaction techniques, to aid humans in better generating, interpreting, evaluating, and deploying statistical and machine learning models. In this special issue, we will feature cutting-edge research where interactive visual analytics methods are applied together with complex computational methods for making explainable and accountable decisions informed by data.

Scope, Description, and More Information

This special issue invites submissions that feature original research on designing, developing and evaluating interactive visual analytics methods that empower their users to make explainable and accountable inferences and decisions based on massive amounts of data. A suitable submission must also demonstrate its relevance to TiiS, the premier journal featuring interactive intelligent systems with two distinct characteristics: intelligence and interactivity. In particular, a suitable submission must exhibit or discuss how the resulting approaches, techniques, or systems advance an interactive intelligent system. Interdisciplinary and applied research is especially encouraged.

Specific areas of interest include, but are not limited to:
  • Role of interactive visualization in interpretable and explainable machine learning
  • Human factors in making decisions with machine learning models
  • Facilitating algorithmic transparency and accountability through visual analytics
  • Interactive visualization for supporting non-experts in creating and interpreting complex analysis results
  • Visual analytics for interactive, informed machine-learning model building
  • Uncertainty-aware visual analytics for the consideration of inherent uncertainty in data and models
  • Interactive visual analytics for addressing biases in the data and machine learning models
Schedule
  • Full paper submission deadline: November 17, 2019
  • First author notification: Feb 14, 2020
  • Revised paper due: April 20, 2020
  • Final author notification: May 15, 2020
  • Expected publication: Summer 2020

Check out tiis.acm.org/authors.cfm for author information and submission details.
For further information, please contact cagatay.turkay@city.ac.uk.
